title: How to Make Sweet Butternut Squash Bisque

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 400°f (204°c).
steps.description: While that is warming, prepare the squash. Cut in half lengthwise and clean out seeds. Put them in the baking dish, 1 Tbsp butter, salt, black pepper and a tsp of brown sugar in each half and bake for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Clean and peel the root vegetables and slice lengthwise.
steps.description: Quarter the potato and onion. Put on the baking sheet and bake in a 450° oven for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Peel and core the apple.
steps.description: Either in a saucepan or microwave, cook until soft right through.

steps.headline: Heat the water and cream in a saucepan.
steps.description: Bring it to short of a boil so the cream doesn't create a skim on the surface.

steps.headline: Spoon out the flesh of the squash into the saucepan over medium heat.
steps.description: Add the vegetables as soon as they're ready. Bring the mixture to a hard simmer to reduce. Incorporate the brown sugar and butter to taste.

steps.headline: Blend with the immersion blender unto fully smooth.
Pour the mixture through a fine strainer to remove fibers from the carrots, onions and celery.

text: Preheat oven to 400°f (204°c). While that is warming, prepare the squash. Cut in half lengthwise and clean out seeds. Put them in the baking dish, 1 Tbsp butter, salt, black pepper and a tsp of brown sugar in each half and bake for 30 minutes. Clean and peel the root vegetables and slice lengthwise. Quarter the potato and onion. Put on the baking sheet and bake in a 450° oven for 30 minutes. Peel and core the apple. Either in a saucepan or microwave, cook until soft right through. Heat the water and cream in a saucepan. Bring it to short of a boil so the cream doesn't create a skim on the surface. Spoon out the flesh of the squash into the saucepan over medium heat. Add the vegetables as soon as they're ready. Bring the mixture to a hard simmer to reduce. Incorporate the brown sugar and butter to taste. Blend with the immersion blender unto fully smooth. Add cornstarch to thicken. Pour the mixture through a fine strainer to remove fibers from the carrots, onions and celery.  Finished.
